intro: Helianthella quinquenervis, commonly known as the five-veined sunflower, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and typical sunflower-like appearance. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small yellow flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
